member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(__m128)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given 128-bit variable as a source. We do not recommend to use this method unless you have a clear understanding of SSE2.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.quat)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given source quaternion.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(hvec4)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given hvec4 source vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Produces a zero vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.vec4)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector by copying a given source vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.vec2,float,float)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given two-component vec2 source vector and two scalars.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.vec3,float)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given three-component vec3 source vector and a scalar.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(float,float,float,float)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using given float values.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(float)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given scalar value: x=v, y=v, z=v, w=v.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.vec2)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given two-component vec2 source vector: x=v.x, y=v.y, z=0.0f, w=1.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.vec3)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given three-component vec3 source vector: x=v.x, y=v.y, z=v.z, w=1.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.dvec4)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given dvec4 source vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.ivec4)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given ivec4 source vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(bvec4)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given bvec4 source vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(svec4)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given svec4 source vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(float)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given pointer to the array of float elements: x=v[0], y=v[1], z=v[2], w=v[3].
member.param: Pointer to the array of float elements.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(Unigine.dvec2,Unigine.dvec2)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using given two dvec2 source vectors.

member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using given two vec2 source vectors.

member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using given float values.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.#ctor(float,ConstexprTag)
member.summary: Constructor. Initializes the vector using a given constant scalar value: x=v, y=v, z=v, w=v.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.abs
member.summary: Returns the absolute values of the vector components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.set(float,float,float,float)
member.summary: Sets the vector by components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.set(float)
member.summary: Sets the vector using the array of float elements: x=val[0], y=val[1], z=val[2], w=val[3].
member.param: Pointer to the array of float elements.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.set(Unigine.vec4)
member.summary: Sets the vector equal to the specified source vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.set(Unigine.vec2,float,float)
member.summary: Sets the vector using a two-component vec2 source vector and two scalars.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.set(Unigine.vec3,float)
member.summary: Sets the vector using a three-component vec3 source vector and a scalar.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.set(Unigine.quat)
member.summary: Sets the vector using a quaternion.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.set(float)
member.summary: Sets the vector components equal to specified scalar value: x=val, y=val, z=val, w=val.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.get(float) const
member.summary: Gets the vector: val[0]=x, val[1]=y, val[2]=z, val[3]=w.
member.param: Pointer to the array of float elements.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.get
member.summary: Returns the pointer to the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.get const
member.summary: Returns the constant pointer to the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.length const
member.summary: Returns the length of the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.length2 const
member.summary: Returns the squared length of the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.maxXY const
member.summary: Compares the X and Y components of the vector and returns the greater one.
member.returns: The greater out of the X and Y components of the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.maxXYZ const
member.summary: Compares the X, Y, and Z components of the vector and returns the greatest one.
member.returns: The greatest out of the X, Y, and Z vector components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.max const
member.summary: Compares all components of the vector and returns the greatest value.
member.returns: The greatest out of the vector components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalize
member.summary: Returns normalized vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalizeValid
member.summary: Normalizes a vector, makes its magnitude equal to 1. When normalized, a vector keeps the same direction but its length is equal to 1. Check for the zero vector is performed: if the argument is a zero vector, then a zero vector is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalizeFast
member.summary: Returns normalized vector, calculated using the fast inverse square root algorithm.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalizeValidFast
member.summary: Returns normalized vector, calculated using the fast inverse square root algorithm. Check for the zero vector is performed: if the argument is a zero vector, then a zero vector is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalize3
member.summary: Returns the vector with normalized XYZ components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalizeValid3
member.summary: Returns the vector with normalized XYZ components. Check for the zero vector is performed: if the argument is a zero vector, then a zero vector is returned.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalizeFast3
member.summary: Returns the vector with XYZ components normalized using the fast inverse square root algorithm.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.normalizeValidFast3
member.summary: Returns the vector with XYZ components normalized using the fast inverse square root algorithm. Check for the zero vector is performed: if the argument is a zero vector, then a zero vector is returned.

member.summary: Performs type conversion to const float *.

member.summary: Performs type conversion to float *.

member.summary: Performs type conversion to void *.

member.summary: Performs vector addition.

member.summary: Performs vector negation.

member.summary: Performs vector subtraction.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator/=(float)
member.summary: Performs componentwise division of the vector by the scalar. Implemented using the calculation of inverse scalar value with subsequent by-component multiplication.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator/=(Unigine.vec4)
member.summary: Performs componentwise division of vectors.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator=(__m128)
member.summary: Sets the vector using a given 128-bit variable as a source. We do not recommend to use this method unless you have a clear understanding of SSE2.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator=(Unigine.vec4)
member.summary: Performs vector assignment. Destination vector = Source vector.

member.summary: Performs array access to the vector item reference by using given item index.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator[](int) const
member.summary: Performs array access to the vector item by using given item index.

member.summary: Multiplies the vector by the value of the specified argument.

member.summary: Multiplies the vector by the value of the specified argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.mul3(float)
member.summary: Multiplies the X, Y, and Z components of the vector by the value of the specified argument.

member.summary: Returns the result of division of the vector by the value of the specified arguments.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.div(Unigine.vec4)
member.summary: Returns the result of division of the vector by the value of the specified arguments.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.sum const
member.summary: Returns the sum of vector components.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.add(float)
member.summary: Performs addition of the specified argument.

member.summary: Performs addition of the specified argument.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator+=(float)
member.summary: Performs addition of the specified value.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.sub(float)
member.summary: Subtracts the argument from all elements of the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.sub(Unigine.vec4)
member.summary: Subtracts each element of the specified argument from ther corresponding element.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator-=(float)
member.summary: Subtracts the argument from all elements of the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.operator=(float)
member.summary: Sets the vector components equal to specified scalar value: x=val, y=val, z=val, w=val.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.lengthFast const
member.summary: Returns the length of the vector (fast version).

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.iLength const
member.summary: Returns the inverted length of the vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.iLengthFast const
member.summary: Returns the inverted length of the vector (fast version).

member.name: M:Unigine.Math.vec4.parseColor(char)
member.summary: Converts a color string in the Web format (RRGGBB / #RRGGBB or RRGGBBAA / #RRGGBBAA) into its vec4 equivalent.
member.param: Color string in the Web format.
member.returns: Color value as a vec4 vector (R, G, B, A).

member.name: F:Unigine.Math.vec4.vec4_blue
member.summary: Blue color vector (0, 0, 1 1).

member.name: F:Unigine.Math.vec4.vec4_black
member.summary: Black color vector (0, 0, 0 0).

member.summary: Vector filled with epsilon constant (1e-6f).

member.name: F:Unigine.Math.vec4.vec4_green
member.summary: Green color vector (0, 1, 0 1).

member.name: F:Unigine.Math.vec4.vec4_inf
member.summary: Vector filled with infinity constant (1e+9f).

member.name: F:Unigine.Math.vec4.vec4_one
member.summary: Vector filled with ones (1).

member.summary: Red color vector (1, 0, 0 1).

member.summary: White color vector (1, 1, 1 1).
